channel.title: Leetcode on Charvis Yang
channel.description: Recent content in Leetcode on Charvis Yang

item.title: LeetCode #2 Add Two Numbers
item.description: Question You are given two linked lists representing two non-negative numbers. The digits are stored in reverse order and each of their nodes contain a single digit. Add the two numbers and return it as a linked list. Input: (2 -> 4 -> 3) + (5 -> 6 -> 4) Output: 7 -> 0 -> 8 Analysis We need to be familiar with linked list operations, especially the case in the boundary.

item.title: LeetCode #1 Two Sum
item.description: Question Given an array of integers, find two numbers such that they add up to a specific target number. The function twoSum should return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to the target, where index1 must be less than index2. Please note that your returned answers (both index1 and index2) are not zero-based. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution. Input: numbers={2, 7, 11, 15}, target=9 Output: index1=1, index2=2
